1995: Study stay at Sung Kyun Kwan University, South Korea
1st time attending the 12th World Taekwondo Championship in Manila, Philipines
1996: Training camp with a world champion Kim Cheul-ho (Grevenmacher, Luxembourg)
1st time attending the European Championship (Helsinki, Finland)
1997: Practice sessions on Sung Kyun Kwan University, South Korea
1998: Sejong Taekwondo starts to practice at the elementary school Horáčkova
1999: Korean National exhibition team visits Prague and Bratislava
2000: Study stay at Mi-dong (South Korea) with GM GM Lee Kyu-Hyung (9th Dan)
2008: Training sessions with Korean Tigers in South Korea
2011: Sejong Taekwondo is the first Czech club to be officially registered by Kukkiwon
First historical advancement to the finals of the European Championship in senior category
2012: Seminar with GM Lee Kyu-Hyung and Keimyung University team, Vienna
Training sessions with KTA National Demonstration Team and Korean Tigers, South Korea
2013: Moohwa exhibits at World Sports Festival in Vienna
2014: Moohwa exhibits at Vienna Taekwondo Festival
2015: First historical team medal at the European Championship in senior category (Serbia)
Sejong Taekwondo member participates at World Taekwondo Hanmadang tournament in South Korea as a first Czech representative (2nd place at All-round breaking)
Training sessions at Korean training centre Taekwondo-won & achieving 3rd Class Taekwondo Master international qualification
2016: First historical gold medal from European Para Taekwondo Championship in Warsaw
Training sessions at Taekwondo-won training centre
2017: Silver medal from prestigious Lille Open 2017 international tournament
Gold medal from Spanish Open, G1 Austria Open and Chuncheon Korea Open
First historical bronze medal from World Para Championship London
First visit and training sessions at Taeseong Taekwondo with masters Ji Ho-yong and Ji Ho-chul
2018: Sejong Taekwondo won the title of Czech Republic Poomsae Champion
Gold and bronze medals World Taekwondo Hanmadang, Jeju, Korea
Training sessions in South Korea (Taeseong Taekwondo) with masters Ji Ho-yong and Ji Ho-chul
2019: Sejong Taekwondo defends the title of Czech Republic Poomsae Champion
Training sessions in South Korea (Taeseong Taekwondo) with masters Ji Ho-yong and Ji Ho-chul
2021: Sejong Taekwondo is the Czech Republic Poomsae Champion 3rd time in a row
